title: 30's Blackletter nee "Shaw Text"
content:
I was lucky enough to find "BOOK of AMERICAN TYPES" (1934) today and I came across this pretty face (attached). Does anyone know of a digitized form?

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Photo-on-2009-12-08-at-22.51.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100742/http:/typophile.com/files/Photo-on-2009-12-08-at-22.51.jpg) | 56.26 KB |
author: Chris Washer

comments.content: Actually, it's not necessarily a 30's design, but it's a specimen printed in the 30's so its at least that old. Probably a 19th century design.

Nice indeed.  
I'm by no means a blackletter expert, but it seems to me some ornate version of Old English.  
The unusual part is the bifurcated d stem.  
Here's an horribly anemic version with some similarities:  
 [http://www.dafont.com/english-gothic-17th.font?af=on&text=Repudiated](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415100742/http:/www.dafont.com/english-gothic-17th.font?af=on&text=Repudiated "http://www.dafont.com/english-gothic-17th.font?af=on&text=Repudiated")
